Optimize and automate (4.3.7)

Optimization means to make something as effective and useful as it needs to be. Before an activity can be effectively automated, it should be optimized to whatever degree is possible and reasonable. It is essential that limits are set on the optimization of services and practices, as they exist within a set of constraints which may include financial limitations, compliance requirements, time constraints, and resource availability.

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. Think and work holistically. The guiding principle of "think and work holistically" in ITIL recommends that organizations should consider all four dimensions of the service value system when designing and delivering services. These dimensions include the organization and people, partners and suppliers, information and technology, and value streams and processes. By considering all four dimensions, organizations can ensure that their services are as effective and useful as they need to be, and that they meet the needs of both the organization and its customers. The guiding principles of "focus on value," "start where you are," and "optimize and automate" are also important components of IT service management, but they do not specifically recommend consideration of the four dimensions.
